root.a: Basic theory (What is testing, bug reports, documentation, types, methods, testing directions, etc.) SDLC, STLC
root.c: HTTP Methods of requests to the server.
root.e: Structures of HTTP requests and responses.
root.f: What is JSON, XML. Their structure.
root.g: API testing via Postman (JS, API autotests).
root.q: Removing and reading logs from an external server.
root.w: Sniffing http web traffic via Charles and Fiddler.
root.e: Dev Tools of web browsers (Google Chrome, FireFox).
root.r: VPN. (How it works, why you need it, how to use it, tool options)
root.bb: Building iOS applications on XCode. (Those who do not have a Mac computer, just look)
root.cc: Building Android applications on Android Studio.
root.ee: Setting up proxy and vpn on iOS and Android.
root.ff: Interception (sniffing) of mobile traffic via Charles and Fiddler on iOS and Android.
root.gg: Command line (terminal) Linux (copying, creating, viewing, moving files on servers without a graphical interface)
root.z: Basics of bash scripting, automation of routine tasks on the server.
root.cc: SQL basics (Create, Delete, Drop, Insert Into, Select, From, Where, Join).
root.n: Non-relational database Redis (installation, configuration and use).
root.l: Python. (Learning the basics. Creating a client-server application)
